content.description: Welded dark stone terraces to right facing corner.  Crux at 20 feet and again at overhanging hand crack...great feet with rests.  Top-out debris filled runoff channel as expected...belayer should have adequate cranium container.  Full value.  Solid pro.  Good way to exit lower tier to access north end of upper tier.
content.protection: Standard rack. No anchors.  Belay from moderate sized boulders 30 ft back from ledge.
content.location: Left of the thin 'Good Craic' and 25 feet left of the 'Irish Need Not Apply...' arete.

climbs.name: Rock Art in the Xray Style

content.description: Ledges to start up to pumpy, large incut holds through small overhang.  Sustained moves = +. Closely bolted. Excellent warm up and nice trial for grade.
content.protection: 5 bolts to 2 bolt anchor with quick links (Thanks Larry).  Shares anchor with (36)
content.location: 2nd line left of Shamrock crack.  Start to right of jumbled corner.

climbs.name: Oh, Danny Boy
climbs.fa: Dan Brockway, Mike Howard and Bob D

content.description: Great route just right of Man Who Bought The Beer. Make a weird move off the ground, mantle and then head left up the steep face to a two bolt anchor.
content.protection: Seven clips to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Just right of Man Who Bought The Beer

content.description: V1 Boulder move to stick the upper lip at 2nd Bolt then enter shallow corner protected with Yellow alien, Green Camalot.  Tricky face moves above ledge protected by 2 more bolts.
content.location: Obvious bolted scoop between two crack climbs.

climbs.name: Mescalero
climbs.fa: Mike Howard, Bob D'Antonio, Bill Henson

content.description: Start in thin crack (same as Good Craic) up to ledge.  Move directly up through 3 bolts over bulge.  Excellent pockets through steep section.
content.protection: Camalots in order: Gold or Red, Green, Purple or 2nd green, and finally Red Camalot in shallow pocket above ledge. Then 3 bolts. Two bolt chain anchor. Some may want small wires and/or small cams to supplement.

content.description: Right side of arete to finger crack then turn bulge on bolts after stance.  Nice warm up for area.
content.protection: Finger size pieces between 5 bolts.  2BA with quicklinks.

climbs.name: Jalamanta
climbs.fa: Bob D'Antonio, Mike Howard and Dan Brockway

content.description: Weird moves to start leads to good climbing above.
content.protection: Six bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Above 25 feet right of the Italian Job at a short corner leading up to a roof.

climbs.name: Irish Need Not Apply
climbs.fa: Mike Howard, Bob D'Agrotonio, Dan Brockway

content.description: Start with bouldery move off high ledge under arete and move into Left facing corner (share 2 bolts with "Oh, Danny Boy").  Step right at third bolt then continue up  blunt arete.
content.location: Right of "Danny Boy" and "The Man Who Bought the Beer"

climbs.name: Good Craic
climbs.fa: Mike Howard, Bob D'antonio, Dan Brockway

content.description:
Curving crack trends to right at top and ends in alcove.  Share anchor with DB and INNA.  First route done here (ground up) to place anchors. 

Craic=joke or news; Gaelic
content.location: 10 feet left of the red bolted arete (INNA)

climbs.name: The Italian Job
climbs.fa: Bob D'Antonio, Mike Howard and Dan Brockway

content.description: Pretty cool stemming and pocket climbing. great route.
content.protection: Green camalot at the start and then five bolts to the anchors.
content.location: Just right of Irish Need Not Apply.

content.description: Start in short finger crack (8 ft) to ledge then protect next move into corner with blue Alien(crux). Watch your medial collateral ligaments.  Good placements in corner then thin gear to anchor on last face. Nice trad warm-up.

Obvious left facing corner with crack through small roofs to right of Jalamanta. Start under small roof to layback (crux). Higher up use thin protection to anchor  via easier climbing.  Overall protection is solid.
content.location: First of three dihedrals to right of Jalamanta.

content.description: Right trending thin corner to 3 foot roof mid climb.  Comfortable ledge leads to Right facing off-width corner (can protect pocket on face (gray camalot).
content.protection: Nice to have Camalots to #4 and  small pieces for tips to finger crack (can do with 2 blue #3 camalots).  Small wires useful in first 3rd of climb
content.location: Starts right of the Italian Job.

content.description: Beautiful open book stemming corner.  Solid rock with variety of athletic moves to 2 bolt anchor. One of the best routes at the grade at UV.
content.protection: 8 bolts.  Ignore stuck bit at last bolt.   (Bob pulled the bit out 7/3/11)

content.description:
Northeast facing, recessed, short climbs with nice variety of moderates, trad and steep, pumpy sport lines.  

Good Craic is a term for fun, entertainment, and enjoyable conversation. It is often used with the definite article  the craic. The 'craic' is interpreted as a specifically and quintessentially Irish form of fun.  You may still hear the echos of Bob D's laughter in the walls.
